reviews.review_msg: Made accounting interesting, but he does go off topic a lot in lectures. He tells u what's going to be on the exam which is nice, but doesn't allow a cheat sheet during exams

Robin spends too much class time promoting Big 4 careers. The final exam was very challenging, with a class average of 45%.

That said, his lectures are engaging and students enjoy his teaching style. There is always a lineup to talk to him after class, and he consistently stays late to make sure every student's questions are answered.

Robin expects his students to have same level of knowledge as he does, and this is reflected in his exams.
Final had a class average of 45%
The tests are tough, but the worst part-he gives way less time than what's required. He himself stated that only 5% students in the whole class would be able to complete the exam. Knowledge is not being tested.

By far, the best prof that I've taken. He is very organized and knows exactly what he's doing. Encourages questions and gives very practical answers. Makes the expectations around exams extremely clear. He genuinely cares about his students' success, not just at school but in life outside of school as well!

I take his class after my 9-5 and despite the exhaustion, I attend lecture with excitement. Sure he can be very expressive, but that's the very thing keeping everyone engaged. 
I hope he stays at SFU for as long as possible.

Robin makes learning accounting fun and seem easier than other profs make it out to be. He is funny, genuinely cares about his students learning, and gives out good career advice. He doesn't answer his emails quickly, but I don't blame him b/c he spends so much time  in office hours to make sure everyone's questions are heard and solved. 10/10 guy
Best accounting prof. He genuinely cares about the success of his students and is passionate about what he teaches.

Scott is a really good prof. He provides engaging and high quality videos to explain the key concepts. His Exams are fair. He tests the key concepts. His lecturers are engaging and provides accounting career advice. His lecture videos and ppts are enough to prepare for the exams. Reading the book is not very necessary.

Scott is by far one of the best profs I've had. Keep in mind that BUS 320 is not an easy course, but Scott makes the experience so much better. He has amazing energy and truly cares about his students and you can see that he loves his job. If I have the chance I would definitely take another class with him. Highly recommend!

Very caring, knowledgeable and responsive professor. By far one of my favourite profs at SFU. And sometimes his recorded lectures are also quite witty too (really helps especially during stressful time). Highly recommended!

For real though, take 320 with Scott. I usually never like my profs but this guy is a real one. His lectures and lecture videos are top notch. Cares about students and provides options to those afraid of asking questions publicly. He also has industry experience and gives you advice. Stand up guy.
Good grader, useless lectures

You need to come in to hand in your assignments in paper, about 4-5 of them. Her slides are super long but detailed and if you can memorize them all, you will ace her midterm and exam without reading the book at all. Class average was 50-60%. Group project average was like 91%. She is caring, flexible with deadlines and pretty on top of her emails.

A lot of the critiques of Fereshteh are, unfortunately, valid. She could improve her lectures by simplifying her examples and slowing down in her speech. BUT, Feresheth has one major thing going for her: SHE CARES. If you take her, try talking to her! She may get a little scattered during lecture, but she wants you to understand the material!
Fereshteh is a very nice and caring professor and is always available to answer my questions

You can tell that Fereshteh is nice and cares about her students, but her lectures are painfully boring. It's difficult to stay engaged with such dry lectures, very fast speech, and a constantly fluctuating voice. Low test averages with a high paper average. Responds to emails quickly. Implied that WileyPLUS was required, but that wasn't the case.

Dr Mahmoudian is a very kind woman but not a great teacher. her lectures are very confusing, and she regularly states things (both orally and in her slides) that are incorrect and contradicted by the textbook. she interrupts students while they are trying to ask questions to attempt to answer before she understands what the student is asking
Goodluck, midterm and final were extremely tough for no reason, prof does not prepare you well at all for them.
Fereahteh was an awesome prof I cant wait to take 322 with her.

Class average is incredibly high, especially the group paper (high 80s range). There are discrepancies between her lecture slide answers and Wiley exams/assignments, and you can be penalized without question. She gets confused when you explain your questions (even in person) and a lot of the time, you don't really get your answer. Poor final prep.

I didnt like the online exams and glitches but Fereshteh was a caring prof and tried to correct the online errors. She even removed the last online assignment when there was an error in it. She also gave us a lot of notes to prepare.
The average is too damn high and the final messed up the whole grade.

Although she is accessible to students, but she seems so confused! For example, her submission requires .docx form, but you cant submit .docx on Canvas. She also uses a lot of readily available Wiley questions on her midterm. Thus you can lose a lot of marks for very minor things (e.g. writing 50% rather than 0.5).

Fereshteh was a very positive professor and she makes the learning process fun and worthwhile. She explains the concepts very well, and is very caring towards her students as she is always available. She also provided very helpful tips for the group project and I really enjoyed being in her class. I strongly recommend her to future students.
One of the worst acctg teachers I have had.  Notes are useless, exams are brutal!!!  If you can avoid him, do, because it will affect your amount of knowledge for BUS 321.
funny sense of humour, but is a poor lecturer with his accent, final exams was unbelievably hard
